meanings.sent1: Stop talking bollox and tell me the truth.
meanings.sent2: The book was full of bollox, not worth reading.
meanings.sent3: The politician's speech was such bollox that even the kids knew it.
meanings.sent4: Her excuse was a load of bollox, just like her promises.
meanings.sent5: The teacher could see through his bollox and caught him lying.

meanings.sent1: He got hit in the bollox during the game.
meanings.sent2: The boxer protected his bollox during the fight.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about getting kicked in the bollox.
meanings.sent4: The doctor checked his bollox during the physical exam.
meanings.sent5: The athlete wore a cup to protect his bollox from injury.

meanings.sent1: I managed to bollox up the presentation with my nerves.
meanings.sent2: Don't bollox up this opportunity with your carelessness.
meanings.sent3: He always finds a way to bollox things up, even when it's simple.
meanings.sent4: She tried not to bollox up the recipe, but it still turned out wrong.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic didn't want to bollox up the repair, so he double-checked everything.
